channel.title: [PI] Item Command

item.title: [PI] Item Command
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Do you see the “/* */” Before and after the code?
Why don’t you just remove that…
Remove this if your username isn’t sanity

this is if you use the command ::item and your username is Sanity.
It’s good if you don’t have an owner rank to set it for

I don’t know alot about Java Programming but just from looking at the code below just made my knowledge over java better. I can learn from looking at these things.

if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);

item.title: [PI] Item Command
item.dc:creator: @Insanity6 Insanity6
item.description:
@Insanity6 wrote:

Something so simple I would miss the problem, but my ::item command/ ::pickup isn’t working in PI
Here’s the code in the commands.java

[code=java] }

		/*if (playerCommand.startsWith("item") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Sanity")) {
			try {
				String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
				if (args.length == 3) {
					int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
					int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
					if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
						c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("No such item.");
					}
				} else {
					c.sendMessage("Use as ::pickup 995 200");
				}
			} catch(Exception e) {
				
			}
		}*/[/code]

That’s exactly how it is.
